alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 6:05PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Grafton County through 645 PM EDT... At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newbury to near Thetford Hill State Park. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Littleton, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Haverhill, Franconia, Piermont, Woodstock, Lyme, Lisbon, Bath, Benton, Dorchester, Easton, Ellsworth, Wentworth, Monroe, Lyman, Landaff, Sugar Hill and Orford. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 116 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton
